intro: Onosma tinctoria, commonly known as the Persian bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and striking blue to violet flowers. The plant is herbaceous, often growing to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. Its flowers are typically arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. The plant is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine and steppe environments.
